alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Dawson; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 5:18PM CDT until June 02 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ANDREWS...MARTIN AND SOUTHEASTERN DAWSON COUNTIES... At 518 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles south of Lamesa to 7 miles northwest of Lenorah to 19 miles north of Midland to 11 miles southwest of Andrews, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Storm chaser reports ping-pong ball sized hail 15 miles south-southeast of Andrews along HWY 385 at 5:13 PM CDT. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Ackerly, Lenorah, Tarzan, Sparenberg, Tenmile, Patricia, Klondike and Andrews County Airport. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for western Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
